content.description: Sit start at the arete. From there, follow the arete to the apex, and top out onto the south slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the west arete of Alcatraz.

content.description: Sit start at the arete. From there, traverse right through across the boulder's west face, and finish up the easy slab.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is good throughout.
content.location: It traverses the boulder's west face.

content.description: Start low in a huge, juggy hueco. Move up to the sloping rail or the sidepull adjacent to the sloper. Head left to a good crimp. Move your feet and prepare to make a huge move to a glorious hold about 2 1/2 feet up. Top out.
content.location:
Start on the left side of the west face (the side facing the road). There's a downclimb on the north side.

If you're looking for the boulder, there's a huge boulder with an orange face just south of it and runoff gate just west of it near the road.

content.description: Start on huge sidepull and move right to a jug and a sidepull. Set up for the huge, blind move over the bulge to a good crimp rail.
content.location: Starts right in the center of the west face of the Alcatraz Boulder. There's a downclimb on the north side or the south side.
